verses.verse: Jacob <WH3290> lifted up <WH5375> his eyes, <WH5869> and looked, <WH7200> and, <WH6215> behold, Esau was coming, <WH935> and with him four <WH702> hundred <WH3967> men. <WH376> He divided <WH2673> the children <WH3206> between Leah, <WH3812> Rachel, <WH7354> and the two <WH8147> handmaids. <WH8198>

He put <WH7760> the handmaids <WH8198> and their children <WH3206> in front, <WH7223> Leah <WH3812> and her children <WH3206> after, <WH314> and Rachel <WH7354> and Joseph <WH3130> at the rear. <WH314>
He himself passed over <WH5674> in front of them, <WH6440> and bowed himself <WH7812> to the ground <WH776> seven <WH7651> times, <WH6471> until he came near <WH5066> to his brother. <WH251>
Esau <WH6215> ran <WH7323> to meet him, <WH7125> embraced <WH2263> him, <WH5307> fell on his neck, <WH6677> kissed him, <WH5401> and they wept. <WH1058>

He lifted up <WH5375> his eyes, <WH5869> and saw <WH7200> the women <WH802> and the children; <WH3206> and said, <WH559> "Who are these <WH428> with you? <WH559>" He said, "The children <WH3206> whom God <WH430> has graciously given <WH2603> your servant. <WH5650>"
Then the handmaids <WH8198> came near <WH5066> with their children, <WH3206> and they bowed themselves. <WH7812>

Leah <WH3812> also and her children <WH3206> came near, <WH5066> and bowed themselves. <WH7812> After <WH310> them, <WH3130> Joseph came <WH5066> near <WH5066> with Rachel, <WH7354> and they bowed themselves. <WH7812>
Esau said, <WH559> "What do you mean by all this company <WH4264> which I met? <WH6298>" Jacob said, <WH559> "To find <WH4672> favor <WH2580> in the sight <WH5869> of my lord. <WH113>"
Esau <WH6215> said, <WH559> "I have <WH3426> enough, <WH7227> my brother; <WH251> let that which you have be yours."

Jacob <WH3290> said, <WH559> "Please, <WH4672> no, if I have now found favor <WH2580> in your sight, <WH5869> then receive <WH3947> my present <WH4503> at my hand, <WH3027> because I have seen <WH7200> your face, <WH6440> as one sees <WH7200> the face <WH6440> of God, <WH430> and you were pleased with me. <WH7521>

Please take <WH3947> the gift <WH1293> that I brought <WH935> to you, <WH430> because God has dealt graciously with me, <WH2603> and because <WH3605> I have <WH3426> enough. <WH3605>" He urged <WH6484> him, <WH3947> and he took it.
Esau said, <WH559> "Let us take our journey, <WH5265> and let us go, <WH3212> and I will go before you. <WH3212>"

Jacob said <WH559> to him, <WH113> "My lord knows <WH3045> that the children <WH3206> are tender, <WH7390> and that the flocks <WH6629> and herds <WH1241> with me have their young, <WH5763> and if they overdrive <WH1849> them one <WH259> day, <WH3117> all the flocks <WH6629> will die. <WH4191>

Please let my lord <WH113> pass over <WH5674> before <WH6440> his servant, <WH5650> and I will lead on <WH5095> gently, <WH328> according to <WH7272> the pace of the livestock <WH4399> that are before me <WH6440> and according to the pace <WH7272> of the children, <WH3206> until I come <WH935> to my lord <WH113> to Seir. <WH8165>"

Esau <WH6215> said, <WH559> "Let me now leave <WH3322> with you some of the folk <WH5971> who are with me. <WH559>" He said, "Why? <WH4100> Let me find <WH4672> favor <WH2580> in the sight <WH5869> of my lord. <WH113>"
So Esau <WH6215> returned <WH7725> that day <WH3117> on his way <WH1870> to Seir. <WH8165>

Jacob <WH3290> traveled <WH5265> to Succoth, <WH5523> built <WH1129> himself a house, <WH1004> and made <WH6213> shelters <WH5521> for his livestock. <WH4735> Therefore the name <WH8034> of the place <WH4725> is called <WH7121> Succoth. <WH5523>

Jacob <WH3290> came <WH935> in peace <WH8004> to the city <WH5892> of Shechem, <WH7927> which is in the land <WH776> of Canaan, <WH3667> when he came <WH935> from Paddan <WH6307> Aram; <WH2583> and encamped before <WH6440> the city. <WH5892>

He bought <WH7069> the parcel <WH2513> of ground <WH7704> where he had spread <WH5186> his tent, <WH168> at the hand <WH3027> of the children <WH1121> of Hamor, <WH2544> Shechem <WH7927>'s father, <WH1> for one hundred <WH3967> pieces of money. <WH7192>
He erected <WH5324> an altar <WH4196> there, <WH7121> and called it El Elohe Israel. <WH415>
